page.title: 11THE POTATO HARVEST
page.content: In October potatoes are harvested.Sometimes a machine is used but more often casual workers are employed.Housewives and school children earn from Â£9.00 for a "WHOLE BIT" to Â£4.50 for a "HALF BIT" per day. Until last year school children had 2 weeks holiday at this time but in 1984 there was only 1 week allowed. Fortunately the weather was good and the potatoes were harvested as usual. The farmers, teachers and others protested and so this year in October the holiday will be 2 weeks as before. Potato-harvesters (machines) are improving and may soon take over from people.
